p: In any disaster or pandemic situation, the impoverished members are always the hardest hit. Approximately 85% of farmers in India are small/marginal farmers, and most of them are landless farmers. Therefore, welfare measures to control the damage caused by COVID-19 were undoubtedly complete and very helpful for implementation. Therefore, the focus of the Government should be to save the lives of all citizens. However, people engaged in agriculture and related activities, mainly those who lost income due to informal employment during the blockade, have other options like cash transfer, until the economy recovers [34, 35].
